New Records: Ben Stokes hit his first World Cup hundred
Key Match Events: Ben Stokes smashed a century as England beat the Netherlands
WICKET! Van der Merwe c Rashid b Ali 0 (Netherlands 167-8)
WICKET! Van Beek c Malan b Rashid 2 (Netherlands 166-7)
WICKET! Edwards c Malan b Ali 38 (Netherlands 163-6)
WICKET! Sybrand c Woakes b Willey 33 (Netherlands 90-4)
WICKET! Ackermann c Buttler b Willey 0 (Netherlands 13-2)
WICKET! O'Dowd c Ali b Woakes 5 (Netherlands 12-1)
Pre-Game Insights: England win the toss (yet again) and bat
Buttler keen to remain England white-ball captain despite dismal World Cup
Post-Match Reflections: Ben Stokes is player of the match and of course tries to meh his debut World Cup ton, saying he’s more pleased to get a win – at last.
Buttler’s really happy with the win, saying any time you need someone to stand up, Stokes does that.
Scott Edwards says his team didn’t start well, giving away too many runs, and their innings was the same old story with the bat.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitch was a goodun, he reckons, and just back of a length the bounce was tennis-ball – helpful for leg-side swats – and he used the scoreboard as his friend, looking up at it if ever he felt under pressure to remind himself that there were more balls remaining than he though.
Ben Stokes praises Woakes’ all-round ability and recent record then, asked if he thought about going home, responds as you expect: “Never leave anyone hanging”.
Others: It feels like we know what’s going to happen here: Netherlands will find a few decent hits, but will also keep losing wickets before any partnership can seriously threaten even the prospect of a prospect of victory.
